4/5

Address: 1327 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: A classic menu of homestyle Korean fare is offered by this humble, longtime eatery.

summary.snippet: "The food tastes good, the service is fast, and the price is very reasonable."
"Large menu and decent prices, but quality is aimed at quantity not quality."
"Spicy shrimp and tofu was great and Soon Tofu Jigae was amazing!"

most_relevant.description: As soon as you enter, the atmosphere hints you that you will eat some amazing food. When you take your first bite, you feel joyous  knowing that your initial instincts about this place was accurate. The food here is amazing. Kudos to the chef.
The food was very delicious. The staff were very friendly. I definitely will return here one day but I know now to use the restroom prior because they don’t have a public restroom.
Wonderful food, great staff, nice cozy vibes. Slightly cramped. Would recommend for smaller groups of people.
Food is amazing, rich flavor and large amount. Family style restaurant, don’t expect fancy atmosphere or service. Clean, yummy, reasonably priced food. What more you can ask for? Recommend!

Very delicious food. Only *ONE* issue there was like barley any seafood in any of the dishes.... it's like when the price of seafood doubled they took out more than half of the seafood in the dishes... this makes me very sad. Great customer service though. For example my soup dish only had 2 or 3 pieces of squid in it.. tons of tofu. You can get the idea from what I am saying.

Food is great! I ordered bibimbap on hot stone, which is in store only. A little bit confused first time here since not sure how to order something in store. Space is small and filled up quickly. Very busy in rush hours

Really tasty korean food.
In my opinion, this place would be the one of the few that cooked ‘real’ korean foods in Michigan.
Only one thing I didn’t like was that the soup was a little salty. But except that, it was really great. I would better come with more friends.

Wonderful service, the two ladies at the front were newer and training but took very good care of us despite how busy it got with people dining in and picking up online orders. As did the gentleman running the store today. The food was authentic and delicious, so good that I cleaned my entire plate. Try the Bibimbap and the Pajeon (Korean Pancakes)!  Definitely come try Kangs!!
